name: beatifying
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
beatify
to announce formally in the Roman Catholic Church that someone who is dead has lived a holy life, usually as the first stage in making that person a saint
to describe or think of someone as if they are extremely good and have no faults: He beatifies his first wife while celebrating his own extra-marital affairs.
